title: CountPlus vows to make a profit decently
text:
CountPlus CEO Matthew Rowe has vowed to make the purchase of almost 400 financial planners from Commonwealth Bank profitable from the get-go after receiving shareholder approval for the deal.

Mr Rowe said he was keen to prove the synergies between accounting and financial advice, with the business expected to turn a profit in its first year.

CountPlus CEO Matthew Rowe said the business wanted to "make a decent profit, decently". Supplied

“We have long been believers that there are clear benefits in businesses that provide both accounting services, and financial advice.”

Mr Rowe’s statement was made in response to shareholder approval given to the firm to acquire financial advice business Count Financial from CBA for $2.5 million with 99.76 per cent of shares voted in favour.

CountPlus is an accounting company spun out of Count Financial in 2010. Financial Review Rich Lister Barry Lambert founded both companies and sold Count Financial to CBA for $373 million in 2011. Mr Lambert retired as chair of CountPlus in 2017.
description: Accounting firm founded by Barry Lambert gets shareholder support to buy back business he sold for $373 million for a song.
